Copied from Daniel Ballinger's FishOfPrey.com : Response.Clear(); string content = @""; Response.ContentType = "image/gif"; Response.BinaryWrite(System.Convert.FromBase64String(content)); Response.End(); I don't speak C#, but if you use this string in your program, you can save storing and accessing one extra file on disk.
